6
7// SystemInfo.h: gathers information available without starting a GPU driver.
8
9#ifndef GPU_INFO_UTIL_SYSTEM_INFO_H_
10#define GPU_INFO_UTIL_SYSTEM_INFO_H_
11
12#include <cstdint>
13#include <string>
14#include <vector>
15
16namespace angle
17{
18
19using VendorID = uint32_t;
20using DeviceID = uint32_t;
21
22struct VersionInfo
23{
24 uint32_t major = 0;
25 uint32_t minor = 0;
26 uint32_t subMinor = 0;
27 uint32_t patch = 0;
28};
29
30struct GPUDeviceInfo
31{
32 GPUDeviceInfo();
33 ~GPUDeviceInfo();
34
35 GPUDeviceInfo(const GPUDeviceInfo &other);
36
37 VendorID vendorId = 0;
38 DeviceID deviceId = 0;
39
40 std::string driverVendor;
41 std::string driverVersion;
42 std::string driverDate;
43
44 // Only available via GetSystemInfoVulkan currently.
45 VersionInfo detailedDriverVersion;
46};
47
48struct SystemInfo
49{
50 SystemInfo();
51 ~SystemInfo();
52
53 SystemInfo(const SystemInfo &other);
54
55 bool hasNVIDIAGPU() const;
56 bool hasIntelGPU() const;
57 bool hasAMDGPU() const;
58
59 std::vector<GPUDeviceInfo> gpus;
60
61 // Index of the GPU expected to be used for 3D graphics. Based on a best-guess heuristic on
62 // some platforms. On Windows, this is accurate. Note `gpus` must be checked for empty before
63 // indexing.
64 int activeGPUIndex = 0;
65
66 bool isOptimus = false;
67 bool isAMDSwitchable = false;
68 // Only true on dual-GPU Mac laptops.
69 bool isMacSwitchable = false;
70 // Only true on Apple Silicon Macs when running in macCatalyst.
71 bool needsEAGLOnMac = false;
72
73 // Only available on Android
74 std::string machineManufacturer;
75
76 // Only available on macOS and Android
77 std::string machineModelName;
78
79 // Only available on macOS
80 std::string machineModelVersion;
81};
82
83// Gathers information about the system without starting a GPU driver and returns them in `info`.
84// Returns true if all info was gathered, false otherwise. Even when false is returned, `info` will
85// be filled with partial information.
86bool GetSystemInfo(SystemInfo *info);
87
88// Vulkan-specific info collection.
89bool GetSystemInfoVulkan(SystemInfo *info);
90
91// Known PCI vendor IDs
92constexpr VendorID kVendorID_AMD = 0x1002;
93constexpr VendorID kVendorID_ARM = 0x13B5;
94constexpr VendorID kVendorID_Broadcom = 0x14E4;
95constexpr VendorID kVendorID_GOOGLE = 0x1AE0;
96constexpr VendorID kVendorID_ImgTec = 0x1010;
97constexpr VendorID kVendorID_Intel = 0x8086;
98constexpr VendorID kVendorID_NVIDIA = 0x10DE;
99constexpr VendorID kVendorID_Qualcomm = 0x5143;
100constexpr VendorID kVendorID_VMWare = 0x15ad;
101constexpr VendorID kVendorID_Apple = 0x106B;
102
103// Known non-PCI (i.e. Khronos-registered) vendor IDs
104constexpr VendorID kVendorID_Vivante = 0x10001;
105constexpr VendorID kVendorID_VeriSilicon = 0x10002;
106constexpr VendorID kVendorID_Kazan = 0x10003;
107
108// Known device IDs
109constexpr DeviceID kDeviceID_Swiftshader = 0xC0DE;
110constexpr DeviceID kDeviceID_Adreno540 = 0x5040001;
111constexpr DeviceID kDeviceID_UHD630Mobile = 0x3E9B;
112
113// Predicates on vendor IDs
114bool IsAMD(VendorID vendorId);
115bool IsARM(VendorID vendorId);
116bool IsBroadcom(VendorID vendorId);
117bool IsImgTec(VendorID vendorId);
118bool IsIntel(VendorID vendorId);
119bool IsKazan(VendorID vendorId);
120bool IsNVIDIA(VendorID vendorId);
121bool IsQualcomm(VendorID vendorId);
122bool IsGoogle(VendorID vendorId);
123bool IsSwiftshader(VendorID vendorId);
124bool IsVeriSilicon(VendorID vendorId);
125bool IsVMWare(VendorID vendorId);
126bool IsVivante(VendorID vendorId);
127bool IsApple(VendorID vendorId);
128
129// Use a heuristic to attempt to find the GPU used for 3D graphics. Sets activeGPUIndex,
130// isOptimus, and isAMDSwitchable.
131// Always assumes the non-Intel GPU is active on dual-GPU machines.
132void GetDualGPUInfo(SystemInfo *info);
133
134// Dumps the system info to stdout.
135void PrintSystemInfo(const SystemInfo &info);
136
137VersionInfo ParseNvidiaDriverVersion(uint32_t version);
138
139#if defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_MACOS) || defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_MACCATALYST)
140// Helper to get the active GPU ID from a given Core Graphics display ID.
141uint64_t GetGpuIDFromDisplayID(uint32_t displayID);
142
143// Helper to get the active GPU ID from an OpenGL display mask.
144uint64_t GetGpuIDFromOpenGLDisplayMask(uint32_t displayMask);
145
146// Get VendorID from metal device's registry ID
147VendorID GetVendorIDFromMetalDeviceRegistryID(uint64_t registryID);
148#endif
149
150} // namespace angle
151
152#endif // GPU_INFO_UTIL_SYSTEM_INFO_H_
153
